home-text:
Welcome to Education4Climate, the web-application that enables you to search for University and High School courses or programmes on climate & environmental sustainability and professors with teaching expertise in these fields.

Our vision and goals

Environmental sustainability has become a major concern for all citizens and for youths, in particular. The transition into a CO2 neutral society toward 2050 decided by the European Union is a major step in favour of the climate and our environment, which not only requires massive investments and changes in the fields of industry, services or infrastructure, but also human intelligence, skills and competences, to drive the ecological transition.

If education is key for sustainability, from child to adults, Universities and High Schools play a particular role, since they educate most of the decisions makers, key players and experts of our community. Education4Climate aims at promoting education on climate and environmental sustainability in Universities and High Schools by facilitating access to information on the programmes and courses that tackle these topics.

Education4Climate will help future students to select the programme or University/High School which best address their aspirations, and programmes manager will find a very useful to monitor, confront and improve their education programmes. Lastly, Education4Climate offers an easy access to identify professors with proven teaching expertise on climate and environmental sustainability, a first step toward efficient knowledge sharing and community building.

How does it work ?

The application crawls the universities websites and uses a simple natural language algorithm to identify the courses that explicitly cover climate and environmental sustainability. A more detailed description of our methodology can be found here.

Programmes, courses and professors can be filtered by: universities, themes and fields. The fields covers what is classically known as ‘Faculty’, which have often various names, depending on the university. High Schools are not yet covered at the moment, and will be implemented by the end of 2021.

Who are we ?

Education4Climate is driven by the Shifters Belgium, with the support of the Belgian branch of the SDSN, The Shift and The Shift Project.

How to Contribute ?

There are several ways you can contribute to Education4Climate:

Share your voice

You are a student, or a professor ? Your voice and experience matters. – Take our survey.

Help us referencing courses, programmes or professors

You have noticed an error or an omission ? – Contact us

Help us improving the algorithm

You would like to propose improvement to our algorithm ? – Contact us

Help us expending Education4Climate to other countries

Expending Education4Climate to new countries will facilitate international collaborations and networking between universities, while addressing to your local demand. Our application was developed with scale-out in mind and is open-access. – Contact us

Referencing

Please reference this site as Education4Climate.(be/org)

Contact us

education4climate@theshifters.org

How the algorithm works

The Education4Climate project works through an algorithm whose objective is to identify which courses and programs at each school and university cover certain themes related to climate and environmental sustainability. A more detailed description of the methodology can be found here.

The purpose of this data processing is to list on our site, for information purposes, the courses and programs that deal with issues related to the climate and the energy transition. The purpose of this project is therefore to increase the visibility of these courses and their teachers.

Cookies

Cookies are small information files which are automatically stored on your computer's hard drive when you visit a website and which contain a unique identification number.

These cookies make it easier for the user to visit the website in question and to navigate it. They can be used to tailor the site to your personal preferences (language) and also allow analysis of the use of a website.

The configuration of most browsers gives you the option of accepting or rejecting cookies and to notify you each time a cookie is used. You can refuse cookies, although this may affect optimal browsing practice and the functionality of the services offered on the site. You can find more information in the help function of your browser.

When you visit our site, certain cookies are stored on your browser, namely cookies necessary for the operation of the site and cookies for statistical purposes (Google analytics).

In this article, you will find a summary of how we use data for Google Analytics, as well as our commitment to ensuring its confidentiality and security.
